author: C.A.-P.
title: En images. Des aurores bor√©ales ont √©t√© aper√ßues dans le ciel de la Haute-Loire
text: En images Des aurores bor√©ales ont √©t√© aper√ßues en Haute-Loire et dans la Loire Dans la nuit de jeudi √† vendredi, le ciel a offert un beau spectacle aux observateurs du ciel. Teint√©es de rose et violet, des aurores bor√©ales ont illumin√© le ciel. Dans la nuit de jeudi √† vendredi, certains observateurs ont eu la chance de contempler des aurores bor√©ales dans le ciel de la Haute-Loire et de la Loire. Ce ph√©nom√®ne est d√ª √† une importante √©ruption solaire. Teint√© de rose et de violet, le ciel a offert un joli spectacle visible √† l'≈ìil nu. Certains de nos lecteurs nous ont partag√© leur clich√© de ce rare ph√©nom√®ne. √Ä La Chapelle-d'Aurec D'autres internautes ont partag√© leurs photos sur les r√©seaux sociaux. A Saint-Jeures Les aurores bor√©ales √©taient √©galement visibles dans la Loire, √† Saint-√âtienne, Saint-Just-Saint-Rambert ou encore dans le Pilat. √Ä lire aussi >> [Aurores bor√©ales : ¬´ Un ph√©nom√®ne tr√®s rare √† notre latitude ¬ª](https://www.leprogres.fr/science-et-technologie/2024/05/11/aurores-boreales-un-phenomene-tres-rare-a-notre-latitude) Le soleil conna√Æt un pic d‚Äôactivit√© Il y a tout juste quatre mois, le 11 mai, [on avait d√©j√† pu observer ce ph√©nom√®ne dans le ciel de nos d√©partements](https://www.leprogres.fr/environnement/2024/05/11/aurores-boreales-un-spectacle-magique-dans-la-nuit-de-nos-departements). Laurent Asselin, m√©diateur scientifique au plan√©tarium de Saint-√âtienne, expliquait alors : ¬´Les aurores bor√©ales r√©sultent de la conjonction de deux ph√©nom√®nes : d‚Äôune part le soleil qui conna√Æt un pic d‚Äôactivit√©, avec des √©ruptions qui envoient des particules dans l‚Äôespace. Et d‚Äôautre part le champ magn√©tique de la Terre, qui d√©vie ces particules vers les p√¥les. Habituellement, on observe ce pic d‚Äôactivit√© du soleil tous les onze ans. L√†, le ph√©nom√®ne intervient avec un peu d‚Äôavance puisqu‚Äôon l‚Äôattendait en 2025

author: Get News
title: Cultural Fusion: Chinese Artists Enchanted Audiences at 2024 ArtExpo | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
The American Asian Arts Inc. (AAAI) is a professional art organization with a significant scale and influence in the Asian American community. This year, AAAI assembled a powerful team of Chinese artists and their artworks have become one of the most stunning highlights of the 2024 "ArtExpo New York!‚Äù
art exhibition of original works, prints, oil paintings, sculptures, photography, digital painting, and other art forms. Every year, thousands of artists bring tens of thousands of new artworks to this art extravaganza. Tens of thousands of art enthusiasts gather here each time, including gallery owners, art dealers, interior designers, architects, and art retailers. Undoubtedly, it has become one of the world's largest platforms for art trading.
Over the past half-century, the NY ArtExpo has fostered many world-renowned painting artists, including Andy Warhol, Peter Max, Ellen Zhang Qiong, Robert Indiana, and many other art masters who rose to fame, all of them launched their fame at the NY ArtExpo!
ArtExpo New York is one of the world‚Äôs largest comprehensive exhibitions of original works, prints, oil paintings, sculptures, photography, digital painting, and other artworks. Thousands of artists from around the world participate in this art event every year, bringing with them tens of thousands of new artworks. Each time, tens of thousands of art enthusiasts, including gallery owners, art dealers, interior designers, architects, and art retailers, gather here, undoubtedly making it one of the world's largest platforms for art transactions.
Over the past half-century, ArtExpo New York has nurtured many world-renowned painting masters, including Andy Warhol, Peter Max, Ellen Zhang Qiong, Robert Indiana,, and many other art masters who rose to fame, all of them alunched their fame at the ArtExpo New York.
At this year's "ArtExpo New York," the delegation of Chinese artists representing Shanghai, Zhejiang, and Fujian, led by Dr. Zhang Yaowei, Executive Dean of the Chinese Calligraphy Institute of Shanghai, President of the Shanghai Cultural and Artwork Appraisal Promotion Association, and internationally renowned calligraphy and painting artist, has presented works that are the most splendid and dazzling at this expo, receiving high praise from art experts and enthusiasts from around the world.
Here are some of the artworks and achievements of the participating artists:
Dr. Zhang Yaowei: an accomplished scholar and calligrapher. Also known as Yaoyi and Rizhe, with studio names of Daohuaixuan and Daonanzhai, Dr. Zhang is a Ph.D. holder, researcher, and professor. He serves as the President of the Shanghai Cultural and Artwork Appraisal Promotion Association, Executive Dean of the Chinese Calligraphy Institute of Shanghai, founder of Daonan University Hall, Vice Chairman of the National School Sports Federation Robotics Committee, Director of the Shanghai Representative Office of the China International Calligraphy and Painting Art Research Association, member of the Shanghai Calligraphers Association, and painter at the Shanghai Calligraphy and Painting Academy. He has held various positions in Shanghai municipal government agencies, Shanghai TV station management, and executive roles in newspaper groups. Dr. Zhang has organized and participated in numerous calligraphy and painting activities, exhibitions, and events, receiving widespread recognition. His artworks have been exhibited domestically and internationally, with notable exhibitions including the "Stand in the Snow at the South Gate - Zhang Yaowei's Personal Ink Exhibition" at the Shanghai Library in January 2020 and the "Art and Philosophy and Zhang Yaowei Exhibition" hosted by the World Art Center and the Association of Chinese Students and Scholars in Manhattan, New York, in June 2023, where his works were collected by collectors.
Dr. Zhang Yaowei showcased the following masterpiece to artists, art critics, collectors, and art enthusiasts from nearly 30 countries at the ArtExpo New York this year:
Title: Love.
Artist Name: Yaowei Zhang
Size: 50cm x 50cm
Material: Rice paper, watercolor
His works received high praise from art lovers. One collector from New York, moved to tears by Dr. Zhang's paintings, said, "I haven't seen such magnificent Chinese works in America before. Chinese art is the source of world art!‚Äù
Xue Chan: Artist, Director of the American Asian Arts Society, born by the West Lake in China, enjoys playing the zither, chess, calligraphy, writing poetry, and songs with a passion for music. She studied under famous artists and doctoral scholars such as Mr. Li Kuizheng. Xue Chan has participated in numerous domestic and international art exhibitions, including the National Contemporary Excellent Painters Tour Exhibition and the ArtExpo New York. Some of her works have been collected by major art institutions both domestically and abroad. In 2021, she was honored with the "Lifetime Achievement Award" by the American Asian Arts Society.
The artistic style of Xue Chan's works is characterized by elegance and classical purity, transcending the mundane with a Zen-like purity akin to snow. Through the rhythm of the graceful poetry style, she imbues the ethereal Zen sentiment with pure ink charm, gracefully emerging from the artistic conception of Tang and Song poetry. The charm of ink wash painting is unique to China, and while Xue Chan's works are cool and elegant, they possess a refined and elegant demeanor. Amidst the dazzling array of colors, they exude a unique and extraordinary charm. Like Bo Ya meeting Zhong Ziqi, she wishes to encounter kindred spirits amidst lofty mountains and flowing waters.
This year, Xue Chan showcased her following masterpiece at the "ArtExpo New York":
Title: Zen Enlightenment.
Artist: Dr. Chan Xue
Size :18‚Äùx26‚Äù
Material: Rice Paper and Ink
Mr. Zhang Weizong: Born in 1956, Mr. Zhang has been engaged in painting for over 50 years, specializing in oil painting and Chinese painting. He currently serves as a painter at the Shanghai Calligraphy and Painting Academy and is a director of the Shanghai Cultural Promotion Association. His works combine Eastern and Western elements, displaying a passion and naturalness that is both refreshing and extraordinary. Exhibited in art galleries in Taiwan, Japan, Singapore, Australia, and domestic venues, his works have been widely praised and loved by audiences. Many of his pieces have been featured in major newspapers, magazines, and media outlets in Shanghai. Additionally, his works have been included in publications such as "The Names of Shanghai Calligraphy and Painting Seal Engravers," "One Hundred Contemporary Maritime Landscape Paintings," and "One Hundred Contemporary Maritime Floral and Bird Figure Paintings and Calligraphy." His numerous artworks are extensively collected by art lovers both in China and overseas.
This year, Mr. Zhang Weizong presented the following masterpiece at the "ArtExpo New York:
Title: WATER VILLAGE AFTER RAIN,
Artist: Weizong Zhang
Size: 75cm x 50cm
Material: Rice Paper and Ink.
Chen Guixu: Born in Fujian Province, China, in 1978, Mr. Chen is a member of the Chinese Folk Artists Association, a director of the Shanghai Aesthetics Society's Calligraphy and Painting Special Committee, the founder and inheritor of the Bamboo Painting and Calligraphy Intangible Cultural Heritage Project, and the chairman of Jiufu Bamboo Painting and Calligraphy Art Development Co., Ltd. From a young age, Mr. Chen has had a passion for painting. He began his artistic career in 1998 and studied Chinese landscape painting under the guidance of the renowned Chinese painting masters Zhang Weizong, a disciple of Zhu Yizhan, Wu Hufan, and Zhang Daqian, and Cai Guozhong, a disciple of Zhang Daqian.
Inspired by bamboo slips from the Han Dynasty and bamboo curtain paintings from the Qing Dynasty in 2015, Mr. Chen persisted in creating bamboo curtain paintings. He also explored innovations in painting and calligraphy on bamboo pieces, achieving success in his endeavors. In 2022, "Zhenhe Bamboo Painting and Calligraphy" was recognized as an intangible cultural heritage protection project by Nanping City.
Mr. Jin Bosong is a well-known senior painter and critic in the Chinese maritime school. Mr. Jin highly praises Chen Guixu's painting art as follows: "Mr. Chen Guixu's works are majestic, with profound brushstrokes and far-reaching artistic conception. They appear to be traditional Chinese paintings, but many new ideas from the painter can still be discerned. The artistic conception is vivid, which is an important criterion among the six principles of painting standards proposed by the literary critic Xie He in the Jin Dynasty and has always been the primary criterion for literati to measure painting art. In his paintings, we feel a kind of inexhaustible momentum rushing towards us. Guixu's paintings absorb the overhead composition of 'Jiangshan Ruoci Duo Jiao' by Fu Baoshi and Guan Shanyue, depicting the love for the motherland's landscapes to the fullest extent, and fully utilizing the perspective function of traditional Chinese painting's scattered points. The large green blocks absorb the decorative color blocks of 'Qianli Jiangshan Tu' by the great Northern Song painter Wang Ximeng, portraying the magnificent momentum of today's landscapes in layers. What's more exciting is that Mr. Chen Guixu has innovatively created bamboo painting and calligraphy art. He skillfully writes and draws on bamboo pieces, integrating the artistic beauty of painting and calligraphy with the natural beauty of bamboo textures, achieving excellent artistic effects, which is truly worth celebrating."
This year, Chen Guixu showcased the following masterpiece at the "ArtExpo New York‚Äù:
Title: Thousands of Mountains
Artist: Chen Guixu
Size: 32‚Äùx88‚Äù
Material: Bamboo and watercolor
To promote the profound and extensive cultural and artistic heritage of China and to commend outstanding contributions made by Chinese and Chinese-American individuals in recent years in the fields of painting, sculpture, art curation, media promotion, art appreciation, and collection, the "Sino-American Cultural and Art Association," "American Asian Arts Inc.," "Shanghai Chinese Calligraphy Institute," "Shanghai Cultural and Artwork Appraisal Promotion Association," "Global Dragon TV," "American East-West Art and Culture Association," "YANBO HUANG ART Studio," and "Beijing Guoyunlou Academy" jointly hosted the "2024 ArtExpo New York Exhibition Awards Ceremony and Press Conference."
(2024 ArtExpo New York Exhibition Awards Ceremony and Press Conference)
The "2024 ArtExpo New York Exhibition Awards Ceremony and Press Conference" was jointly hosted by the internationally known bilingual television host, author, and television producer, Ms. Rose Hong from Global Dragon TV, and the senior international art exhibitor, Mr. James Tao.
Mr. Wang Jiangang, Vice Chairman of the United Nations Journalists Association, delivered the opening speech. Vice Chairman Wang Jiangang highly praised the outstanding artistic achievements of the participating artists and the contributions made by Chinese and Chinese-American artists to world culture and Sino-American relations! He warmly congratulated the award winners!
Mr. Charles P. Wang, President of the Chinese American Cultural and Art Association, former Vice Chairman of U.S. Commission on Civil Rights appointed by the former U.S. President, George H.W. Bush and the most senior Chinese-American politician and social activist in the United States, delivered a speech and presented the following commendations:
Zhang Yaowei - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Xue Chan - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Zhang Weizong - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Yanbo Huang - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Zheng Lingjiang - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Zhang Huangping - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Chen Guixu - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Ye Xian - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Rose Hong - International Outstanding Art Media Person Gold Award
Ellen Qiongzhao Schicktanz - Lifetime Achievement Award for World Art Leadership Award
James Tao - Outstanding Contribution Award for International Art Exhibitor Award
Mr. Sunny Wang - Outstanding Achievement Award for International Meritorious Art Appreciation Award
Mr. Li Tongxin, Honorary Chairman of the American Asian Arts Inc. and President of the American East-West Art and Culture Association, a renowned Chinese-American master of calligraphy and painting living in the United States, delivered a speech and presented the following commendations:
Zhang Yaowei - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Zhang Weizong - Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award
Chen Guixu - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Xue Wei - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Zhang Huangping - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Zheng Lingjiang - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Chen Wenli - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Zhu Zhechi - Contemporary Artist Outstanding Academic Innovation Award
Award-winning guests, represented by Mr. Zhang Yaowei, recipient of the "Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award," Mrs. Yanbo Huang, recipient of the "Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award," and Mrs. Ellen Qiongzhao Schicktanz, recipient of the "Lifetime Achievement Award for World Art Leading Figures," delivered speeches on behalf of the award recipients.
(Dr. Zhang Yaowei was awarded the "Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award" by Mr. James Tao, Executive Chairman of the American Asian Arts Inc., and Mr. Li Tongxin, President of the American East-West Art and Culture Association, a renowned Chinese-American master of calligraphy and painting living in the United States, and was interviewed by Global Dragon TV.)
International renowned soprano singer, painter, and the New York-based artist, Miss Ye Xian, who achieved fame by performing alongside the world-famous tenor Sergi Carreras at the Milan International Fashion Show in 2024, performed Mozart's famous opera "Der H√∂lle Rache" from "The Magic Flute." Her beautiful and resonant voice shook the entire audience, bringing the award ceremony to its climax.
Several American fashion models showcased silk shawls and hand-painted leather bags designed by internationally known fashion designer, and showcased at London and Milan Fashion shows, enhancing the perfect fusion of art and fashion by Mrs. Yanbo Huang, recipient of the "Meritorious Artist Outstanding Artistic Achievement Award."
Mr. Wang Yu, Vice President of the Chinese Mouth Organ Association, judge of the 10th World Asia-Pacific Mouth Organ Competition, and recipient of the "New York City Mayor's Award," performed his own adaptation of "The Song of the Yangtze River" on the harmonica, receiving high praise from the audience!
The evening concluded with a beautiful performance of the Yi ethnic dance music by Miss Zhang Boyu (Sunshine Baby), a renowned pipa player in the United States, the chief pipa player of the New York CBA Cultural and Arts Center, and an UN Peace Music Ambassador.
From April 4th to April 7th, 2024, the "2024 ArtExpo New York" was held at Pier 36 in Manhattan, the art capital of the world. On the evening of April 6th, the "2024 ArtExpo New York Art Exhibition Awards Ceremony and Press Conference" concluded successfully at the luxurious Royal Queen Hotel Restaurant in Flushing, New York City.
The American Asian Arts Inc. is a professional art organization with significant influence in the Asian-American community in the United States. It specializes in planning, implementing and promoting art exhibitions, media campaigns and art appreciation and collection for Chinese and Asian artists in the United States and globally.
Its official website is www.americanasianarts.com, and email address is: americanasianart@gmail.com
Global Dragon TV provided news coverage. Its official website is: www.GlobalDragonTV.com and email address is: GlobalDragonTV@gmail.com
Media Contact
Company Name: Global Dragon TV
Contact Person: Media Department
Email: Send Email
Phone: 1-703-901-6588
Address: 10329 Democracy Lane
City: Fairfax
State: VA
Country: United States
Website: http://www.globaldragontv.com

title: P√©rou: un vaste incendie ravage le centre historique de Lima - Le Temps
text:

Plusieurs centaines de pompiers luttent, mercredi, contre un vaste incendie dans le centre historique de Lima. Il n'a pas fait de bless√©s pour le moment, ont indiqu√© les autorit√©s.
Vue a√©rienne de l'incendie √† Lima, le 4 mars 2025. ‚Äî ¬© CONNIE FRANCE / AFP Le feu s'est d√©clar√© lundi soir dans un entrep√¥t de jouets et de produits alimentaires, avant de se propager √† d'autres b√¢timents commerciaux, a indiqu√© √† la cha√Æne t√©l√©vis√©e N un responsable des pompiers. ¬´L'incendie pourrait se poursuivre jusqu'√† dimanche¬ª, a-t-il estim√©.
Plusieurs habitants ont √©t√© contraints de quitter leur logement, certains emportant leur matelas, leur frigidaire ou des chaises. Une √©paisse fum√©e noire √©tait visible √† plusieurs kilom√®tres du sinistre.
Des b√¢timents pas aux normes ¬´Nous sommes dans le centre historique de Lima, o√π il y a beaucoup d'entrep√¥ts. C'est une v√©ritable bombe √† retardement pour les habitations¬ª, a t√©moign√© aupr√®s de l'AFPTV Zulli Cabanillas, un habitant du quartier qui a d√ª quitter son logement.
Mario Casaretto, en charge de la gestion du sinistre pour la municipalit√©, a fait √©tat de ¬´onze familles sinistr√©es¬ª.
Les pompiers tentent d'√©teindre l'incendie qui ravage un magasin de jouets dans le centre de Lima, le 4 mars. Plusieurs r√©servoirs d'eau aliment√©s par des camions-citernes ont √©t√© d√©ploy√©s dans la zone sinistr√©e. ‚Äî ¬© CONNIE FRANCE / AFP Le responsable des pompiers a affirm√© que les b√¢timents touch√©s ne respectaient ¬´aucune norme¬ª. Outre l'absence d'escalier de secours, ils ne disposent pas de syst√®me anti-incendie, a-t-il soulign√©. Parmi les rares bouches d'incendie certaines sont ¬´hors d'usage¬ª, a-t-il d√©plor√©.

author: Scott Solomon
title: United Cajun Navy aids local Texas Hill Country flood relief efforts amid disaster
text:
LITTLE ROCK (KATV) ‚Äî The United Cajun Navy has been actively aiding flood relief efforts in the Texas Hill Country, responding to one of the state‚Äôs deadliest disasters.
KATV Channel 7's Kaelin Clay met with them today to learn more.
This volunteer group, founded after Hurricane Katrina, has joined local teams to navigate hazardous conditions while searching for survivors and assisting families affected by the catastrophic flooding.
Their dedication has been critical as officials continue to search for more than 160 people still missing in Kerr County.
The United Cajun Navy‚Äôs selfless work highlights the power of community and volunteerism in times of crisis.

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Grande festa degli alberi con i bambini della scuola Loru-Dess√¨  - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
Gli alunni delle quinte elementari dell'istituto comprensivo Loru-Dess√¨ di Villacidro sono stati protagonisti ieri dell‚Äôiniziativa di tutela e sensibilizzazione ambientale organizzata dalle scuole in collaborazione con l‚Äôassociazione Sa Cumpangia de su Cumpringiu. Le classi hanno piantato quaranta alberelli fra il parco di via Farina e quello di via don Sturzo, in cui sono state messe a dimora anche due giovani magnolie nate dai semi della storica magnolia che si affacciava fino a pochi anni fa sul Lavatoio e che molti villacidresi ricordano con affetto e nostalgia.
¬´Siamo orgogliosi di aver preso parte a una mattinata di grande valore educativo e civico ‚Äì commenta la dirigente Marinella Giorri ‚Äì la festa degli alberi √® un‚Äôopportunit√† per avvicinare i nostri studenti ai temi dell‚Äôecologia e della sostenibilit√†, facendoli diventare protagonisti attivi nella cura del territorio. La collaborazione con realt√† associative rafforza il legame tra scuola e comunit√†, contribuendo a formare cittadini consapevoli e responsabili¬ª. Soddisfatti anche i volontari dell'associazione, che hanno insegnato ai bambini come piantare gli alberi. ¬´Abbiamo donato a ogni classe un vademecum, per gestire al meglio il nostro patrimonio verde¬ª, conferma Marco Leo, fra i fondatori della ‚ÄúCumpangia‚Äù. ( m. m. )

author: VNExplorer
title: Josh Taylor's death on Bribie Island: Brisbane man buried alive under 1.5m of sand 'planned powerful act for his girlfriend'
text:
Josh Taylor was laid to rest on December 20 He revealed to his father he wanted to propose to his girlfriend READ MORE: Critical unanswered questions about Josh Taylor's death
A young man who was buried alive under 1.5m of sand on a popular Queensland island had plans to propose to his long-term girlfriend before his tragic death.
Josh Taylor‚Äôs life support machine was switched off six days after he fell in a deep pit that was dug in the sand at Bribie Island‚Äôs Woorim Beach on December 2.
The day before the horrific accident, a friend said that Josh told his father, Peter, that he was going to ask his girlfriend, Kaitlynd Odri, to marry him in the new year.
The family friend described how Mr Taylor shared details of his cherished final moments with his eldest son during his funeral service held on December 20 at Centennial Memorial Gardens in Brisbane‚Äôs south-western suburbs.
‚ÄòThe weather was perfect, they fished, they swam and they had a body-surfing competition,‚Äô the friend said.
Josh Taylor had planned on popping the question to his girlfriend Kaitlynd Odri. Both pictured
Josh Taylor (above) died six days after he was buried alive under 1.5m of sand on Bribie Island
‚ÄòThat night they had dinner around the campfire and that‚Äôs when Josh told his dad that he wanted to marry Kaitlynd in the new year.‚Äô
The couple, who weren‚Äôt living together, are understood to have been dating for four years after meeting on the dating app Bumble.
Hundreds of mourners are said to have gathered to farewell the Mr Taylor, an arborist from Brisbane,.
Mourners were asked to wear board shorts, sun dresses and thongs for the occasion to reflect his relaxed, happy-go-lucky attitude to life.
Tragedy struck when Mr Taylor and the group he was with were said to have dug the 1.5m-deep pit to roast a pig under the sand ‚Äì in the style of a Maori hƒÅngƒ´.
There has been an alternative theory floated that the group may have been hunting the island‚Äôs wild boars and dug a sand trap to try to catch one.
Detectives have now launched a criminal investigation into Mr Taylor‚Äôs death.
More than a dozen men, including paramedics and Mr Taylor‚Äôs friends, worked to get him out of the hole
Josh Taylor‚Äôs family farewelled him at a memorial in Brisbane on December 20. Josh is pictured centre
Mr Taylor was said to have fallen into the hole when he stumbled and overbalanced as he got out of a chair, with his flailing arms bringing down its walls on top of him.
He was buried headfirst, with his ankles only barely visible to rescuers, who tried to pull him out after their attempts to dig him out failed.
But the weight of the sand and the suction created as they yanked at him meant even the brute force of 15 men pulling on a rope around his feet was unable to dislodge him.
An off-duty paramedic advised the rescue party to try pulling in a different direction which eventually managed to free him.
But one rescuer, passer-by Nathan, said Mr Taylor‚Äôs body ‚Äòbroke‚Äô as he was released.
‚ÄòAll of his family were screaming at us, telling us to help, telling us to get rope so we could pull him out. It was pretty gruesome,‚Äô Nathan said.
‚ÄòThere were like 15 men on the rope pulling and he did not budge. It was pretty gnarly when he popped out. I threw up.
‚ÄòHe broke. The suction, the force of everyone pulling.‚Äô
Mr Taylor did not have a pulse when he was freed but rangers, friends and family performed CPR for 45 minutes until he was flown to Brisbane‚Äôs Princess Alexandra Hospital where he died six days later.
A GoFundMe by family friend Georgia Hoffman for Josh‚Äôs parents raised more than $70,000 before it was brought to a conclusion.

author: Alex Hammer
title: WHEN THE SKY IS TEAMING WITH TREATING ENERGIES , STAND STRONG and NO FEAR, DISCERN ENVIROMENT -- NORTHERN NEW MEXICO

Áôº‰ΩàÊôÇÈñìÔºö08:44 2023-12-30 Â≠óÈ´îÂ§ßÂ∞è ÈáëÁÆ°Â±ÄÊò®Êó•ÁôºË°®Áµ±Ë®àÊï∏Â≠óÈ°ØÁ§∫Ôºå‰ªäÂπ¥11ÊúàË™çÂèØÊ©üÊßãÁöÑÂ≠òÊ¨æÁ∏ΩÈ°çÊåâÊúàÂ¢ûÂä†1.7%ÔºåÁï∂‰∏≠Ê∏ØÂÖÉÂ≠òÊ¨æÂèäÂ§ñÂπ£Â≠òÊ¨æÂàÜÂà•‰∏äÊº≤0.5%Âèä2.9%Ôºå‰∏ªË¶ÅÂèçÊò†‰ºÅÊ•≠Ë≥áÈáëÊµÅÂãï„ÄÇËÄåÈ¶ñ11ÂÄãÊúàÔºåÂ≠òÊ¨æÁ∏ΩÈ°çÂèäÊ∏ØÂÖÉÂ≠òÊ¨æÂâáÂàÜÂà•Âçá4.1%Âèä1.7%„ÄÇ
